Text.Page:
A familiar face waited for you in Cultists' Refuge. Jelena greeted you with enthusiasm.

Elleon, however, was nowhere in sight, and Jelena explained that the team was split up by a mysterious force after using the teleportal.

Jelena also explained she was injured in the process and barely escaped with the help of her younger sister.

After Jelena asked you to help her sister, you learned Elleon had gone deeper in pursuit of Lok cultists.

You went after Elleon and infiltrated the Cultists' Refuge, then joined forces with Elleon and defeated Priestess Akia and her servant, Terkasia.

You then destroyed Samael's soul stone, with which Akia was planning to resurrect Samael.

This ended the conflict with the Cult of Lok.

Jelena was injured but took the time to send word for you, then followed Elleon through the portal.

Let's hope both reckless hearts avoided death once more.

Blast and fire, I am glad to see you, ! I haven't found Elleon yet, but I need your help! My twin sister, Davina, is among the missing. I wasn't strong enough to stay with her.

It gets worse. The Scions of Lok are crawling all over this place, but there's another group here—Atel Akaad. I've never heard of them, and that worries me.

I'm not strong enough to go with you, but we need to find our friends—find Davina. Please!

This place is a maze! Don't know where Elleon vanished to, but we last saw Davina to the east. Unfortunately, the doors slammed down and cut us off.

If you can use the {@LinkCreature:489#1008#Eastern Wardstone}, you can open the eastern door and rescue Davina!

Done talking. Start killing.

Oh, thank you! I can't believe I was captured so easily. I'm just glad Jelena didn't see me like this.

Elleon stepped through that western doorway in the central hall, but it slammed shut before I could follow! I could hear him fighting off a whole horde of cultists.

The guards said the {@LinkCreature:489#1011#Western Wardstone} just east of here opens the door, but be careful. {@LinkCreature:489#3609#Galanos} is guarding the stone.

Thank you for rescuing Davina! Oh, I could kiss you!

If Elleon's gone west, that's where you need to head next.

Akia—remember her?—is rallying the Scions of Lok and working with these Atel Akaad creeps.

Nullu's been mapping the place. She'll steer you right to Akia. Find her and end her!

You can't kill Akia until you kill Terkasia. Go find Akia in the priest's chamber in the western section.

She's very cunning. Expect the unexpected.

Find the treacherous script and summon {@LinkCreature:489#3802#Terkasia}. Only then can this be ended.

Sorry I was running behind. Too many cultists around here.

Looks like you didn't need me, anyway. A resurrected Samael—knowing all our secrets, but beyond our reach—would have been a disaster.

This altar shouldn't stand any longer. Its very existence keeps Samael's spirit from the Dream, ready to come back whenever some wild-eyed cultists beckon.

Would you do the honors? Set these explosives around {@LinkCreature:489#100#Samael's soul stone} and end this once and for all."Me?"
More than anyone, you've fought this battle. Seems only fitting that you bring it to its conclusion.

Akia and Terkasia are dead, and the remaining Scions are scattered, leaderless.

We have new enemies, . Those Ksharans are argons. That's plain enough. But this "Atel Akaad" group...it seems like the Cult of Lok was just their puppet.

Bah! Enough ruminating. Someone owes us a great number of drinks!
